articles.description: Listen to radio commentary and follow updates as England open their FIFA Women's World Cup campaign against Haiti.
articles.title: Women's World Cup: Build-up as England open campaign against Haiti

articles.description: Follow live text, Test Match Special commentary and in-play clips from the fourth day of the fourth Ashes Test between England and Australia at Emirates Old Trafford.
articles.title: Ashes: Build-up to day four as England seek series-levelling win

articles.description: United States launch their bid for an unprecedented third consecutive world crown with a comfortable win against Women's World Cup debutants Vietnam in Auckland.
articles.title: USA launch World Cup defence with victory over Vietnam

articles.description: BBC Sport's Liam Loftus challenges Lionesses including Ella Toone, Keira Walsh, Georgia Stanway and Katie Zelem to take on the beer mat flip challenge.
articles.title: Lionesses take on the beer mat flip challenge

articles.description: Lionel Messi scores a stunning stoppage-time free-kick on his Inter Miami debut to clinch a 2-1 victory against Mexican side Cruz Azul.
articles.title: Messi scores late winner on Inter Miami debut

articles.description: Hinata Miyazawa scores twice to help Japan to a dominant 5-0 win against Fifa World Cup debutants Zambia in Hamilton, New Zealand.
articles.title: Dominant Japan fire five past debutants Zambia

articles.description: Elite players have lost their minds on the closing two holes at Royal Liverpool. So what might happen there on Sunday?
articles.title: The two holes where Open dreams might go to die

articles.description: A year on from a serious knee injury and surgery, UFC heavyweight Tom Aspinall returns to face Marcin Tybura at the O2 Arena on Saturday.
articles.title: 'I feel like I've got a new leg' - UFC's Aspinall

articles.description: Hinata Miyazawa finishes off a "brilliant" move against Zambia to give Japan the lead in their Women's World Cup match.
articles.title: Miyazawa finishes off 'brilliant' move to give Japan lead

articles.description: England's Jonny Bairstow says criticism of his wicketkeeping in the Ashes has been "out of order".
articles.title: Criticism of my keeping 'out of order' - Bairstow
